commit_message:
Add split-controlplane-standalone.yml playbook

Add split-controlplane-standalone.yml playbook which uses
two standalone nodes to deploy a central node and an "edge"
node.

After deploying the control node, its endpoint data is extracted
and formatted into environment files. The env files are then
used to deploy the edge compute node.

Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I84a35d529ee67e939db1cdadd103f88295e41e8f
Change-Id: Icdd91d50c12076c022d0bc85b8df9db3c34170be
Implements: blueprint split-controlplane-ci
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/epic/327

commit_message:
Fix get-modulename.py for python3

ConfigParser got renamed in Python 3 to configparser, update
get-modulename.py so that it now runs under python3.

Change-Id: Ic32b22d537ce43fb5382fdad4b550061d9060c6e

messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-09 11:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-09 11:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-10 00:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-03-18 17:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This looks really cool. 

Since this is a WIP, I'm wondering if we are going to duplicate this patch on the openstackclient repo[1]. I've never contributed to the OSC before, so this could be a silly question.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/tree/master/openstackclient"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-18 18:11:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Since this is a WIP, I'm wondering if we are going to duplicate this patch on the openstackclient repo[1]. I've never contributed to the OSC before, so this could be a silly question.
[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/tree/master/openstackclient

> working on 'delete share', I realized that in the documentation for argument --share-group-id is listed as --share-group[1], when in the repositories functions create and delete are managing --share-group-id[2]. I don't know if I'm getting this right or the documentation is wrong.

In most cases, we alias the command arguments, for example, take a look at [3]. In the documentation, only one form will be listed. Aliases help with user experience; they also make things a bit more consistent. Although, your question seems to be different. Can you ask, with the specific line number from your link [2]?

[3] https://github.com/openstack/python-manilaclient/blob/180ab3e0a2928c8c49da0b34172854acf14025ca/manilaclient/v2/shell.py#L1338-L1340"}, {'account_id': 29958, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:21:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Both of them are using '--share-group-id' as arguments, but you're saying that, for the user, I keep '--share-group' for the user's input(in my code the 'add_argument') and then try to parse that input to use it as '--share-group-id' for the functions(e.g. create and delete)?"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-07-18 17:35:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Both of them have patch sets that fix this and we are waiting them to merge in order to continue this implementation."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-10-29 12:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

Show by name does *not* work. show by id *works*.

manila-cli gets all shares then gets by id

REQ: curl -i -X GET https://xxx.xxx.xxx:8786/v2/09fce77b-5412-44b3-bd1e-120a4f2406e9/shares/detail?all_tenants=1&is_public=True -H "X-Auth-Token: xxx" -H "X-Openstack-Manila-Api-Version: 2.49" -H "User-Agent: python-manilaclient" -H "Accept: application/json"

REQ: curl -i -X GET https://xxx.xxx.xxx:8786/v2/09fce77b-5412-44b3-bd1e-120a4f2406e9/shares/f81a94cf-0ef4-491e-b808-e708d91b59b3/export_locations


OSC tries to get or delete directly by name.

curl -i -X GET https://xxx.xxx.xxx:8786/v2/09fce77b-5412-44b3-bd1e-120a4f2406e9/shares/test-osc -H "X-Auth-Token: xxx" -H "X-Openstack-Manila-Api-Version: 2.49" -H "User-Agent: python-manilaclient" -H "Accept: application/json"


Delete doesn't work with name nor id
it tries to delete by name directly.

The strange part is that, it gets all shares first and then still tries to delete by name. 

curl -i -X DELETE https://xxx.xxx.xxx:8786/v2/09fce77b-5412-44b3-bd1e-120a4f2406e9/shares/test-osc'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-10-29 12:54:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

commit_message:
[OSC] Init OpenStack Client implementation

Add an OSC plugin for manila, the subcommand
chosen is "share". Add initial commands parser
for create, delete, list and show shares.

Also initializes basic unit testing structure for
the added commands.

Co-Authored-By: Soledad Kuczala <sol.kuczala@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>

Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support
Change-Id: I90a36f4332796675ea808e0c2a0f5ce32709624a

subject: Implement simple prometheus metrics for nova.

[{'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-04 08:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-03-04 09:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-28583 : SUCCESS in 1h 08m 18s'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-04 09:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-03-04 12:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-28596 : SUCCESS in 1h 41m 32s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-03-04 13:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/640688/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 39m 48s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-04 17:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

Presumably this will want a bp/spec etc.

(How) does this relate to ceilometer?'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-04 21:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

I might write a spec, but to be honest as a hobbyist working in the evenings its hard to be enthused about process stuff.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-04 23:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-05 07:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-05 07:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Realistically the other option here is to run a web server inside nova-compute which serves the /metrics URL itself. I'm just not super excited about yet another server inside nova."}, {'account_id': 6794, 'date': '2019-03-05 15:37:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Disclosure: I'm part of the team maintaining Prometheus.

As stated in the documentation [1][2], the Pushgateway is targeted for very specific use cases (mostly services that don't live long enough to be scraped by Prometheus). I'd definitely recommend exposing the metrics via HTTP. FWIW there is a group of people/companies working together to turn this exposition format into a standard [3] meaning that eventually such other monitoring systems than just Prometheus will be able to consume the exposed metrics.

[1] https://prometheus.io/docs/practices/pushing/
[2] https://github.com/prometheus/pushgateway#non-goals
[2] https://openmetrics.io/"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-05 22:15:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Simon. I think my concerns about yet another server in nova-compute still stand, but I agree that pushgateway isn't the way forward. That said, I'm going to leave it like this for now. Why? Because this is experimental code to prove that embedded metrics are useful and interesting. I see the publication mechanism as something easy to change later as required. Maybe we'll end up writing our own sidecar metrics server that does auth or something."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-03-14 05:44:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This patch implements new function, so a blueprint and a spec are required, aren't they?
A release note should be added because new config options are added."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-18 08:42:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This code was an experiment, and it seems that nova-core aren't too excited by the idea of adding monitoring metrics to nova so I am not sure this will go much further."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-19 14:29:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Procedural -2. This is obviously something that is going to require discussion since it goes against one of our development policies:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/policies.html#metrics-gathering'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-19 14:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Here are a few more random metrics related things in nova:

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=#server-usage-audit-log-os-instance-usage-audit-log - added for ceilometer, who knows if it works anymore

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=#show-hypervisor-statistics - could probably be replaced with placement at some point

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=#show-hypervisor-uptime

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d3254af0fe2b15caff3990c965194133625b681d/nova/compute/manager.py#L7513 - xen specific (I think) which again, who knows if this still works or is tested anywhere

https://github.com/openstack/nova/tree/d3254af0fe2b15caff3990c965194133625b681d/nova/compute/monitors - not tested nor maintained

So before we start adding more metrics stuff into nova, we should have a frank discussion about the existing things we have which are not maintained or tested.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-19 15:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-03-19 15:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> So before we start adding more metrics stuff into nova, we should
 > have a frank discussion about the existing things we have which are
 > not maintained or tested.

If I'm understanding the intent here, this patch is to start the process of making nova export metrics about things for which it is authoritative (number of instance starts, for example). My recollection of all the previously hated and shot down efforts with the word "metrics" in the name were more centered around nova being abused as a collection daemon for system (or other) stats in order to avoid having to install a dedicated metrics-gathering daemon on a system. That sort of "meh, nova is already there, just make it collect and report stats about system disk usage, cache misses, etc" goal is what I've previously objected to (among others with similar concerns). Nova exporting metrics for which it is authoritative is pushing things in the right direction of depending on something else for metrics, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-03-19 15:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I also remember this old ML thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/thread.html#67283'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:11:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Michael, also, stuff like [1] is not really helpful here at all. A one-sided post on social media because people are asking questions about your proposal does not help to make me (and I'm assuming others) to want to work with you on this.

[1] https://twitter.com/mikal/status/1107787256012562433"}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:26:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

While I totally understand the reasoning behind having Prometheus collecting Nova metrics, I just feel that trying to transform Nova as a publisher agent on time-based metrics to a very specific tool is trying to put square peg in a round hole.

Nova already exposes a REST API that Prometheus can consume on a pull model, Nova already emits notifications that are event-based that some collector can get and provide its own API (or push to any other gateway) and there are already Prometheus OpenStack exporters. 

There are surely some gaps on collecting metrics that we can discuss and see how we can expose those (either thru the existing Placement or Nova APIs, or thru notifications) but we also agreed on the fact that metrics collection isn't a thing Nova would pursue [1]

Leaving a strong -1 because there are probably some events we miss but it's pretty close to a -2.
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/policies.html#metrics-gathering"}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The Prometheus OpenStack Exporter I mentioned is explained in this blogpost https://medium.com/@pasquier.simon/monitoring-your-openstack-instances-with-prometheus-a7ff4324db6c'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-03-19 23:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Matt, you'd already told me you saw no value in exposing monitoring metrics and that new efforts in that direction were in fact forbidden in the code base, so I didn't realise we were working together on this.

The reality is that there is an industry consensus growing around how to do this stuff. At the moment people use the nova API to expose metrics (google for "nova prometheus exporter"), but its slow and limited in what it can do.

The purpose of these metrics is to provide internal tuning and alerting data for the behaviour of nova. That said, I'm a depressed middle aged hobbyist. Core clearly doesn't see the value in this so I'm not going to push it any further. Perhaps I'll hack something up for personal use because its of interest to me, perhaps not.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-03-20 22:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-06 18:51:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This doesn't have any movement or positive interest since last March, so I'm going to abandon it. If it needs to be restored and moved forward, infra-root will need to remove Matt's -2."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-06 18:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Implement simple prometheus metrics for nova.

This is a toe in the water to expose metrics that I think
operational staff need to monitor nova well. There have been
previous attempts to expose some of this data via nova-api
calls, but it hasn't been great and some of the calls they
make are very expensive.

This isn't prometheus specific, its just the case that I care
about. I've tried reasonably hard to do this in a generic
manner which should work for other monitoring systems, but I'd
be interested in feedback.

Change-Id: I36e911ca935af53d6ef4fc2382a1487c950fa619

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] fix the issue with ceph-osd init

This is to fix the issue with ceph-osd initilization when deployed
with wal and db on same disk as pod restart always trying to prepare
the disk.

this ps will make sure to handle the case and skip the ceph-volume prepare
step in case of already deployed osd disk.

Change-Id: I5c37568f342cb4362a0de0a9c11a52b7aea3e147

subject: Fix seed VM provision
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-06 13:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-01-06 13:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-06 16:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-01-06 16:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-06 13:45:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix seed VM provision

Since I56533ead8357945a42b079fda7edbd9912fc135a (present in 7.0.0.0rc1),
seed VM provisioning fails due to a missing configdrive volume. The
problem is caused by the stackhpc.libvirt-vm role at version 1.8.0, and
the issue is described in
https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-vm/issues/45.

This change bumps the requirement for stackhpc.libvirt-vm to v1.10.0,
which includes a fix for the issue.

Change-Id: I7361510a1c9c9c25356c5abd2a68b661c6b52692
Story: 2007063
Task: 37929
(cherry picked from commit a076ae6dc3c84a36bf6501222d90a5eea47abd34)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix seed VM provision

Since I56533ead8357945a42b079fda7edbd9912fc135a (present in 7.0.0.0rc1),
seed VM provisioning fails due to a missing configdrive volume. The
problem is caused by the stackhpc.libvirt-vm role at version 1.8.0, and
the issue is described in
https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-vm/issues/45.

This change bumps the requirement for stackhpc.libvirt-vm to v1.10.0,
which includes a fix for the issue.

Change-Id: I7361510a1c9c9c25356c5abd2a68b661c6b52692
Story: 2007063
Task: 37929
(cherry picked from commit a076ae6dc3c84a36bf6501222d90a5eea47abd34)

commit_message:
Simplify octavia post deploy configs

Octavia shares config across multiple services in sometimes unexpected
ways. To avoid problems, this patch merges external deploy tasks
configuration into a single file.

Change-Id: Ifaceb70cac37223ea8f540145e9b74eea02ae0d6
Related-Bug: #1836074

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python2.7 support

As per the official python support timeline
set forth by the OpenStack TC [1][2], OpenStack
Train is the last release that will support
python2.7. manila-tempest-plugin is a 'branchless'
tempest plugin. However, after this change,
users may no longer expect to install this package
with python2.7.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688997/
[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I8c10d169302c6f1c41e238ae9f787455a2b15a4d

[{'created': '2019-12-17 08:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

This patch hardly refactors the TripleO Validator CLI. The 'List'
subcommand has been split in different new subcommands which does "one
thing and only one thing". It also adds the support for the TripleO
history file and integrates better the CLI with the openstack client
library, which simplifies it a lot.

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f

(cherry picked from commit 29b00170b3cf54106b6e43cc42f3b66ce3a3be0b)
'}]
commit_message:
TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

This patch hardly refactors the TripleO Validator CLI. The 'List'
subcommand has been split in different new subcommands which does "one
thing and only one thing". It also adds the support for the TripleO
history file and integrates better the CLI with the openstack client
library, which simplifies it a lot.

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 29b00170b3cf54106b6e43cc42f3b66ce3a3be0b)

commit_message:
fix: admin and member gates are broken

The patrole-admin and patrole-member gates are broken because they
are trying to test a policy action ('os_compute_api:os-services') that
was changed in the Ussuri release. This commit adds a new policy feature
flag so that this policy test is backwards compatible.

Change-Id: Ia80279ae8ffcc17f10bed05338c41d0c23eea063

w

Change-Id: Icb1375b8daf303719ed937d8e4ddd319086dd667

commit_message:
Add horizon to upper-constraints

horizon plugins use horizon as a library.
Having horizon in upper-constraints would be helpful
to avoid unexpected breakage due to a newer horizon releases,
particularly in stable branches.

The reason we don't have horizon in upper-constraints so far is
because most horizon plugins would like to work and test with horizon
in a same branch, but Zuul v3 allows such tests.
This reasoning is no longer true.

Note that horizon has switched to cycle-with-intermediary release mode
in Ussuri so we can have horizon in u-c in the master branch.

Change-Id: I421ee2d498ea5100d9b52e356b46f2d594638b5b

[{'created': '2020-01-03 14:47:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IPA builds without packages specified

Since story 2006855, it is possible to specify a list of packages when
building IPA images. However, this introduced an issue in the case where
no packages are specified. See
https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-os-images/issues/26.

This change fixes the issue by updating stackhpc.os-images role to
v1.7.0, which has a fix for this issue.

Change-Id: I70d20381bec3f5b92bb467e6c506e32bb13548c2

commit_message:
Fix IPA builds without packages specified

Since story 2006855, it is possible to specify a list of packages when
building IPA images. However, this introduced an issue in the case where
no packages are specified. See
https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-os-images/issues/26.

This change fixes the issue by updating stackhpc.os-images role to
v1.7.0, which has a fix for this issue.

Change-Id: I70d20381bec3f5b92bb467e6c506e32bb13548c2
Story: 2007069
Task: 37952

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-03 15:17:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix overcloud provisioning due to Bifrost IPA rename

Kolla recently upgraded bifrost from 7.0.0 to 7.1.0 on the stable/train
branch. This switched to IPA builder to build the IPA image, and
introduced a rename of the IPA kernel file from ipa.vmlinuz to
ipa.kernel, which breaks overcloud provisioning. The iPXE kernel
download fails with a 404, since Kayobe introspection rules use
ipa.vmlinuz for the driver_info.deploy_kernel URL.

This change works around the issue by setting two Bifrost variables,
ipa_kernel and ipa_kernel_url, to reference the old kernel filename of
ipa.vmlinuz. This works both in the case where the image is downloaded
from a URL (ipa_kernel sets the destination file name), and where it is
built via 'kayobe seed deployment image build' (kayobe uses the legacy
ironic-agent DIB element rather than IPA builder, which creates a
hardlink to ipa.vmlinuz).

We chose the above approach rather than switching to IPA builder due to
it being a less risky change at a time close to release. A future
release of Kayobe should switch to IPA builder, but this will be a
larger effort.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692200/1/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: I7f75c25602fd7ae4bfeb6abbdd3b42d8ee465abf
Story: 2007068
Task: 37951
"}]
commit_message:
Fix overcloud provisioning due to Bifrost IPA rename

Kolla recently upgraded bifrost from 7.0.0 to 7.1.0 on the stable/train
branch. This switched to IPA builder to build the IPA image, and
introduced a rename of the IPA kernel file from ipa.vmlinuz to
ipa.kernel, which breaks overcloud provisioning. The iPXE kernel
download fails with a 404, since Kayobe introspection rules use
ipa.vmlinuz for the driver_info.deploy_kernel URL.

This change works around the issue by setting two Bifrost variables,
ipa_kernel and ipa_kernel_url, to reference the old kernel filename of
ipa.vmlinuz. This works both in the case where the image is downloaded
from a URL (ipa_kernel sets the destination file name), and where it is
built via 'kayobe seed deployment image build' (kayobe uses the legacy
ironic-agent DIB element rather than IPA builder, which creates a
hardlink to ipa.vmlinuz).

We chose the above approach rather than switching to IPA builder due to
it being a less risky change at a time close to release. A future
release of Kayobe should switch to IPA builder, but this will be a
larger effort.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692200/1/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: I7f75c25602fd7ae4bfeb6abbdd3b42d8ee465abf
Story: 2007068
Task: 37951

commit_message:
Fix pep8 failures with hacking 2.0.0

It seems hacking 2.0.0 was shipped with incompatible changes
(which is not surprising as this is a new major version).
Let's fix these errors and use a newer hacking.

Change-Id: I8da9dca5d8d74f6dfc2340dabc8d50e6253358e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-06 15:49:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update Zanata script for Python 3.5

Python 3.5 - unlike Python 3.6 - does not accept byte strings in
json.loads, so convert from bytes to string first.

This is needed now since the script is run under python3.5 and not anymore
using python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ie223ab715d6f1c2d77344a9bcc3d3885c3be85c7
'}]
commit_message:
Update Zanata script for Python 3.5

Python 3.5 - unlike Python 3.6 - does not accept byte strings in
json.loads, so convert from bytes to string first.

This is needed now since the script is run under python3.5 and not anymore
using python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ie223ab715d6f1c2d77344a9bcc3d3885c3be85c7

commit_message:
Add reset_interfaces argument to patch_node

Ironic uses reset_interfaces option when patching a node to
reset all the hardware interfaces of a node.
This patch adds that argument to the patch_node method in
the baremetal module and introduces a patch method under
the node module to be able to evaluate the reset_interfaces
parameter.
Also, it modifies the _prepare_request method in resource
to accept query parameters in urls and build the request
uri keeping those into account.

Increasing minimum version of mock to 3.0.0 to be able to use
testing features not supported before that version, e.g.
assert_called_once

Change-Id: I8bca403df7d38a7ac1d066c5f1d7e2bff1deb054

The swift message actions can run into odd transient errors which can be "fixed"
with simple retries. This change ensures all of our swift messaging tasks have
retries and that those retries are all unified with a sensible delay.

Change-Id: I555c21d5108f9227cacc9487bbb4cc45037caf03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add and unify the retries when messages are published to swift

The swift message actions can run into odd transient errors which can be "fixed"
with simple retries. This change ensures all of our swift messaging tasks have
retries and that those retries are all unified with a sensible delay.

Change-Id: I555c21d5108f9227cacc9487bbb4cc45037caf03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2019-12-17 02:36:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-19 14:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-12-19 17:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-20 08:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-06 13:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 02:36:34.000000000', 'message': 'GUI hangs on creation of project in User creation form

On creation of project in user creation form, the response is sent
as html and the javascript try to parse the output as json and fails.

The project creation response should be sent as text/plain so that
javascript can parse the string as json.

The bug have 3 parts
1. Users are not listed on GUI in different domain
2. Projects are not listed on GUI in different domain
3. Gui hangs during creation of user/project using + option
Case 1 & 2 are fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697962/
This patch fixes case 3.

commit_message:
GUI hangs on creation of project in User creation form

On creation of project in user creation form, the response is sent
as html and the javascript try to parse the output as json and fails.

The project creation response should be sent as text/plain so that
javascript can parse the string as json.

The bug have 3 parts
1. Users are not listed on GUI in different domain
2. Projects are not listed on GUI in different domain
3. Gui hangs during creation of user/project using + option
Case 1 & 2 are fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697962/
This patch fixes case 3.

Change-Id: I4936a158ad99cf9d7514e79c06ed2315ce11218b
Closes-Bug: #1826114
(cherry picked from commit 8fb86b2adbdf4fae63faabc8937728c43c1777d5)

commit_message:
Send binary frame in websocket client

Websockify 0.9.0 rejected receiving text frame:
https://github.com/novnc/websockify/commit/8eb5cb0cdcd1314d6d763df8f226b587a2396aa2
We have to switch to binary frame instead.

Change-Id: I2677b8879ccb27def22126811c347d5c08f5aada
Closes-Bug: #1847889
(cherry picked from commit ea2212ebe59567d8ea21778cff5128e1029be045)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 20:53:31.000000000', 'message': "Raise when inventory retrieval & refresh fails

Previously the SchedulerReportClient method _get_inventory, and thus its
only consumer, _refresh_and_get_inventory, would silently return None on
any API failure. With this commit we log the error and raise a new
ResourceProviderInventoryRetrievalFailed exception. This brings this
code path in line with others (e.g. aggregate & trait retrieval) used by
_refresh_associations and update_from_provider_tree.

This will be needed by a future commit fixing the related bug to allow
us to react properly when a provider disappears while we're refreshing
its associations.

Change-Id: I2cec621aaad297cd99347daf219f02b411f706fa
Related-Bug: #1841481
"}]
commit_message:
Raise when inventory retrieval & refresh fails

Previously the SchedulerReportClient method _get_inventory, and thus its
only consumer, _refresh_and_get_inventory, would silently return None on
any API failure. With this commit we log the error and raise a new
ResourceProviderInventoryRetrievalFailed exception. This brings this
code path in line with others (e.g. aggregate & trait retrieval) used by
_refresh_associations and update_from_provider_tree.

This will be needed by a future commit fixing the related bug to allow
us to react properly when a provider disappears while we're refreshing
its associations.

Change-Id: I2cec621aaad297cd99347daf219f02b411f706fa
Related-Bug: #1841481

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB galera IPv6 deployment on CentOS 7

CentOS 7 uses old galera which has multiple issues handling
IPv6 addressing.
This patch applies two workarounds for CentOS 7.

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7c178aba60c389e65075e0e6cbe4dfa5b8ce06ec
Closes-Bug: #1856532
Signed-off-by: yj.bai <bai.yongjun@99cloud.net>
(cherry picked from commit 908bffcfc2950e271fee1af24fb174fa6bee4aff)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-06 08:38:16.000000000', 'message': 'translation job: Fix horizon installation

Horizon was added to upper-constraints.txt in stable branches
recently. This causes a failure in horizon installation in
the translation jobs like [1]. The script tries to install horizon
from the git repo but it conflicts with upper-constraints.

This commit updates the horizon installation to what tox does,
i.e. to install requirements with upper-constraints first and
then install horizon from the git repo.

Note that python modules from test-requirements.txt are now installed.
django-babel (or enmerkar in near future) is what we need here and
it is not a horizon runtime requirement so including test-requirements.txt
allows the horizon team to move django-babel to test-requirements.txt
in future. [2]

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/9d4055098385422580f031c0ee668d2b
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011783.html

Change-Id: Ibdb63d83b368709fdb1a69da3ce4c60d908c0edb
'}]
commit_message:
translation job: Fix horizon installation

Horizon was added to upper-constraints.txt in stable branches
recently. This causes a failure in horizon installation in
the translation jobs like [1]. The script tries to install horizon
from the git repo but it conflicts with upper-constraints.

This commit updates the horizon installation to what tox does,
i.e. to install requirements with upper-constraints first and
then install horizon from the git repo.

Note that python modules from test-requirements.txt are now installed.
django-babel (or enmerkar in near future) is what we need here and
it is not a horizon runtime requirement so including test-requirements.txt
allows the horizon team to move django-babel to test-requirements.txt
in future. [2]

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/9d4055098385422580f031c0ee668d2b
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011783.html

Change-Id: Ibdb63d83b368709fdb1a69da3ce4c60d908c0edb

An example of the failure of the translation jobs is https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/f5c3c186539b41f4b8e9d020de202f4f'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-01-06 09:49:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Translation jobs support Stein and Train - besides master - and these branches should be fine for Python3.

currently all master django repos (horizon and plugins) fail, so let's see whether this is enough to fix it - and if there's a fallout, we need a different solution."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-01-06 10:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Use python3 for translation jobs

Horizon no longer support python2 as it has dropped Django 1.11
support which is the last version with python 2.7 support.
However, the translation jobs still require python2, so the translation
jobs are failing after horizon dropped python2 support.
It is time to ensure python3 in the translation jobs.

Change-Id: Id78484bf5366601b11547e80b772a0eec03622d0

commit_message:
Fix seed VM provision

Since I56533ead8357945a42b079fda7edbd9912fc135a (present in 7.0.0.0rc1),
seed VM provisioning fails due to a missing configdrive volume. The
problem is caused by the stackhpc.libvirt-vm role at version 1.8.0, and
the issue is described in
https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-vm/issues/45.

This change bumps the requirement for stackhpc.libvirt-vm to v1.10.0,
which includes a fix for the issue.

Change-Id: I7361510a1c9c9c25356c5abd2a68b661c6b52692
Story: 2007063
Task: 37929

subject: Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages
messages: [{'account_id': 14972, 'date': '2019-12-20 14:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-30 15:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-06 09:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-20 14:12:47.000000000', 'message': 'Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages

Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages in puppet-nova.
Ex. NovaReservedHugePages: ["node:0,size:2048,count:64","node:1,size:1GB,count:1"]
will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Closes-Bug: #1852385
Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml
Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages

Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages in puppet-nova.
Ex. NovaReservedHugePages: ["node:0,size:2048,count:64","node:1,size:1GB,count:1"]
will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Closes-Bug: #1852385
Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml
Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)

messages: [{'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-12-18 02:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-01-06 11:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 02:59:52.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ChefSpec test speed by enabling caching

This updates all references of let(:chef_run) to cached(:chef_run) to
speed up tests. By doing this, we have to create a new cached(:chef_run)
block whenever we need to adjust node attributes for testing.

In addition:

- Add missing ChefSpec tests for cloud_config and _credential_tokens
  recipes

Change-Id: I9f3b86de8f7aa97a5954b2e0f564452e1897a6e3
'}]
commit_message:
Improve ChefSpec test speed by enabling caching

This updates all references of let(:chef_run) to cached(:chef_run) to
speed up tests. By doing this, we have to create a new cached(:chef_run)
block whenever we need to adjust node attributes for testing.

In addition:

- Add missing ChefSpec tests for cloud_config and _credential_tokens
  recipes

Change-Id: I9f3b86de8f7aa97a5954b2e0f564452e1897a6e3

we need to adjust node attributes for testing.

Speed was improved from 24.75 seconds to 14.75 seconds.

commit_message:
Improve ChefSpec test speed by enabling caching

This updates all references of let(:chef_run) to cached(:chef_run) to speed up
tests. By doing this, we have to create a new cached(:chef_run) block whenever
we need to adjust node attributes for testing. In addition, add missing spec
file for mysql-client-redhat.

Speed was been improved from 27.66 seconds to 20.78 seconds.

Change-Id: I8c095bb4ca298255e09fd59d0e43878423693636

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB galera IPv6 deployment on CentOS 7

CentOS 7 uses old galera which has multiple issues handling
IPv6 addressing.
This patch applies two workarounds for CentOS 7.

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7c178aba60c389e65075e0e6cbe4dfa5b8ce06ec
Closes-Bug: #1856532
Signed-off-by: yj.bai <bai.yongjun@99cloud.net>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-20 06:11:03.000000000', 'message': 'Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages

Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages in puppet-nova.
Ex. NovaReservedHugePages: ["node:0,size:2048,count:64","node:1,size:1GB,count:1"]
will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
Closes-Bug: #1852385
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages

Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages in puppet-nova.
Ex. NovaReservedHugePages: ["node:0,size:2048,count:64","node:1,size:1GB,count:1"]
will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
Closes-Bug: #1852385
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)

commit_message:
Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages

Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages in puppet-nova.
Ex. NovaReservedHugePages: ["node:0,size:2048,count:64","node:1,size:1GB,count:1"]
will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Closes-Bug: #1852385
Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml
Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)

commit_message:
Add filters for shell cmdline

This change adds three filters that can be used to construct shell
command lines in roles.

* shell_arg_enabled - skips adding an arg if enabled=False.
* shell_arg_list - loops through a list to generate a list of command
                   line args.
* shell_logging_path - create a string to capture stdout/stderr to file.

Change-Id: I5dc43e703f7ebe2ca94f4cbf650a7dee3c93ab5f

will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
Closes-Bug: #1852385
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages

Provide option to set reserved_huge_pages in puppet-nova.
Ex. NovaReservedHugePages: ["node:0,size:2048,count:64","node:1,size:1GB,count:1"]
will reserve on NUMA node 0 64 pages of 2MiB and on NUMA node 1 1 page of 1GiB

When NovaReservedHugePages is set, "reserved_huge_pages" is set to the value of
NovaReservedHugePages. If NovaReservedHugePages is unset and OvsDpdkSocketMemory is
set, reserved_huge_pages value is calcuated from KernelArgs and OvsDpdkSocketMemory.
KernelArgs helps determine the default huge page size used, the default is set to
2048kb and OvsDpdkSocketMemory helps determine the number of hugepages to reserve.
when both  NovaReservedHugePages and OvsDpdkSocketMemory are unset, then
NovaReservedHugePages set to default value [].

Change-Id: I8c7a8cb6ebf46130f5d102d281f9b736029b5390
Closes-Bug: #1852385
(cherry picked from commit 6099999336977b4c7553b3393219050e08fd97d8)

subject: Add oslo notification format configuration option
messages:
[{'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-14 17:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-14 18:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-12-16 10:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-12-16 10:12:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi Stamatis.  Thanks for the patch, but I'm admit to being a bit confused by it, and so I'm tentatively putting a hold on it.  I see the new config item, but it doesn't get used by the charm code in this patch?  Also, the two template changes set the config statically, without reference to the config item?"}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-16 11:04:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Hi Stamatis.  Thanks for the patch, but I'm admit to being a bit
 > confused by it, and so I'm tentatively putting a hold on it.  I see
 > the new config item, but it doesn't get used by the charm code in
 > this patch?  Also, the two template changes set the config
 > statically, without reference to the config item?

Hi Alex,

The intention of this patch is to leverage the default charmhelpers mechanism of oslo notifications configuration section. As it can be observed from [1], [2] if such a configuration option is provided by the charm, then the charmhelpers fill the template with the appropriate value.

In my opinion, the original statically set value at the nova.conf it could be avoided because the configuration option could be used with the value 'unversioned' as the default one. Furthermore, I would like as user to have the ability to set it with the configuration option in order to change it. An example use case is OpenStack Watcher which requires this option to be set to 'both' [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller/blob/master/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py#L729
[2] https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller/blob/master/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/templates/section-oslo-notifications#L11
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/latest/configuration/configuring.html#configure-nova-notifications"}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-16 12:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-12-16 14:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Stamatis, so I slightly misread the previous review.  Unfortunately, the config item, with this patchset, still doesn't affect the templates.  i.e. Functionally, all that the patchset does is to remove the config from the pike & rocky nova.conf; the actual config option doesn't do anything as there is no code in-this-charm with this patchset that reads it.  I see you have a separate change on charm-helpers, but that's not in this charm as the file is not synced in.

This is a "classic" charm (not written with the charms.reactive framework), which means that charm-helpers needs to be synced into the charm to get the additional feature (see the 'sync' target in the Makefile).

In order to fix this; the changes to charm-helpers needs to be synced into this charm before this patchset can land.  Hope that makes sense, but if not, please reach out to me (tinwood) on irc.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:32:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

LGTM.  I hadn't fully understood the context of the patch where the notification-format config option is already handled in a charm-helpers change that has already been synced into the charm.

The smoke failure is unrelated to this change."}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-17 14:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-19 11:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-19 19:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-19 20:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-20 10:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-20 10:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-12-20 11:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

LGTM - just pending UOSCI test results.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-12-20 11:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-20 15:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-01-03 09:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2020-01-03 10:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2020-01-06 11:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM -- thanks for the patch, and Happy New Year Stamatis!'}]

commit_message:
Add oslo notification format configuration option

This patch adds a configuration option for oslo notification format.
Charm Helpers can accept this option to fill the configuration
template appropriately.

Change-Id: I9b41854aca91f5ed42844be8805a941bc686336e
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
Add SyslogIdenfier to healthcheck systemd unit

Adding this new field will allow to filter all healthcheck logs using
the Idenfier value.

For instance, using journalctl, you would be able to run this:
`journalctl -t healthcheck_collectd'

It will also allow to get a dedicated file out of (r)syslog if needed.

This is the reflection of Icdc5caf4cedc46291a807c39c0a31c74955a4a74

Change-Id: I6861baa287f2a8288b87be26aacecbcc061cd96f
Closes-Bug: #1856573

commit_message:
Release keystonemiddleware for Ussuri milestone 1

This picks up unreleased changes in keystonemiddleware.
The cycle-with-intermediary deliverables are good to release frequently
whenever there are functional changes to be released. Feel free to -1
this patch if there are additional changes that should be included in
this release or if it is not a good time to do it.

Change-Id: Ie69f834d00986dea719c00085131887370352939
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-04 11:36:27.000000000', 'message': 'Generate HAProxy configuration when upgrading from Rocky to Stein

When upgrading from Rocky to Stein HAProxy configuration moves from using a
single configuration to assembling a file from snippets for each service.
If tags are specified (including haproxy) to limit the upgrade to a subset
of services, HAProxy configuration for any service not specified via tags
will not be generated, and load balancing to those services will cease.

This change applys the HAProxy tag to the entire play, ensuring HAProxy
configuration is generated for all services when the HAProxy tag is
specified.

Change-Id: I67f57c831a713142d38c6e7b70f814a9ee8e5aae
Closes-Bug: #1855094
'}, {'created': '2019-12-04 15:38:08.000000000', 'message': 'Generate HAProxy configuration when upgrading from Rocky to Stein

When upgrading from Rocky to Stein HAProxy configuration moves from using a
single configuration to assembling a file from snippets for each service.
If tags are specified (including haproxy) to limit the upgrade to a subset
of services, HAProxy configuration for any service not specified via tags
will not be generated, and load balancing to those services will cease.

This change applys the HAProxy tag to the entire play, ensuring HAProxy
configuration is generated for all services when the HAProxy tag is
specified.

Change-Id: I67f57c831a713142d38c6e7b70f814a9ee8e5aae
Closes-Bug: #1855094
'}, {'created': '2019-12-21 15:22:28.000000000', 'message': 'Generate HAProxy configuration for all enabled servvices

Change-Id: I67f57c831a713142d38c6e7b70f814a9ee8e5aae
Closes-Bug: #1855094
'}]
commit_message:
Generate HAProxy configuration for all enabled servvices

This change applys the HAProxy tag to the entire play, ensuring HAProxy
configuration is generated for all services when the HAProxy tag is
specified.

Change-Id: I67f57c831a713142d38c6e7b70f814a9ee8e5aae
Closes-Bug: #1855094

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-21 14:53:48.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Increase job run attempts

Attempts affect pre failures.  This means we can increase stability of
jobs by rejecting nodes that fail pre without failing runs at the same
time (unless we are really unlucky and hit b0rken nodes 5 times in a
row).

This change is adapted from I17b7f878c742fa8db66f738526855a02ab9f1905 in
kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: I010b2fdd7c39e3314a9e1c59072d877f635f7522
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Increase job run attempts

Attempts affect pre failures.  This means we can increase stability of
jobs by rejecting nodes that fail pre without failing runs at the same
time (unless we are really unlucky and hit b0rken nodes 5 times in a
row).

This change is adapted from I17b7f878c742fa8db66f738526855a02ab9f1905 in
kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: I010b2fdd7c39e3314a9e1c59072d877f635f7522

unable to connect to epmd (port 4369) on control-1: address (cannot connect to host/port)

these are used in two different ways. in tripleo we use install-engine (not docker) unless this changed in some backports somewhere'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-11-04 18:26:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Alex, currently it's not set if using docker-login file only.  include_tasks: install-engine.yml is in docker.yml, so it will be set anyway. And it's logical to set it before starting docker in task that starts it."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-11-04 19:13:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is why it's in this order https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/rocky/puppet/services/docker.yaml#L152-L158

The issue is specific to the CI usage and that was not the original target for this role."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-11-04 23:04:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, let's discuss it in irc, I can't understand why it shouldn't be before docker starts."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-11-04 23:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-01-06 09:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Ensure no directory listing is active

By default, puppetlabs-apache module enables Indexes option, which can
lead in data/structure leak.

The following patch disable that option on a global base, since we
shouldn't need such a feature.

Closes-Bug: #1854442
Change-Id: Icba53f4e32237556608f4cb6dcd9da1a71705c19
(cherry picked from commit ad48860b75e8eb4c8ceec9835c3422859b210e22)

commit_message:
Account listing for object versioning

During account listings, update `bytes` with sum of bytes from
current version plus the bytes from hidden versions container.

Change-Id: I2c9492822e29817e1b0e9f0bc4f5d4226175081d

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: I29cd34d17a00eb1b576f46d6010203603b5c8165

[{'created': '2019-12-16 16:25:17.000000000', 'message': 'Use graceful_exit=True in ComputeTaskManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize

This passes graceful_exit=True to the wrap_instance_event decorator
in ComputeTaskManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize so that upon successful
completion of the RevertResizeTask, when the instance is hard destroyed
from the target cell DB (used to create the action/event), a traceback
is not logged for the InstanceActionNotFound exception.

The same event is also finished in the source cell DB upon successful
completion of the RevertResizeTask. Note that there are other ways we
could have done this, e.g. moving the contents of the _execute() method
to another method and then putting that in an EventReporter context with
the source cell context/instance, but this was simpler.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: Ibb32f7c19f5f2ec4811b165b8df748d1b7b0f9e4

The same event is also finished in the source cell DB upon successful

commit_message:
Use graceful_exit=True in ComputeTaskManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize

This passes graceful_exit=True to the wrap_instance_event decorator
in ComputeTaskManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize so that upon successful
completion of the RevertResizeTask, when the instance is hard destroyed
from the target cell DB (used to create the action/event), a traceback
is not logged for the InstanceActionNotFound exception.

The same event is also finished in the source cell DB upon successful
completion of the RevertResizeTask. Note that there are other ways we
could have done this, e.g. moving the contents of the _execute() method
to another method and then putting that in an EventReporter context with
the source cell context/instance, but this was simpler.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: Ibb32f7c19f5f2ec4811b165b8df748d1b7b0f9e4

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Iff2d9f64fdbb4cc483773ab709989bbd518839cf

commit_message:
Plumb graceful_exit through to EventReporter

This adds a kwarg to wrap_instance_event to be used in the
EventReporter to allow the caller to tell EventReporter to
gracefully handle InstanceActionNotFound on __exit__.

This will be used by ComputeTaskManager.revert_snapshot_based_resize
which starts an action in the target cell DB but upon successful
exit of the RevertResizeTask the instance in the target cell DB
will be hard destroyed resulting in an InstanceActionNotFound
traceback which should be avoided.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: Ie48a9c0a285f77e260f675fbe9282df9f02282b1

commit_message:
Add container images for DCN/Edge deployments

Add container image support for new GlanceApiEdge and HAproxyEdge
tripleo services. These services are variants of their non-Edge
counterparts, and use the same container images.

Change-Id: Ic8d652a5209219c96f795a8c18ceb457c6d9382a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 22:25:56.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to deploy glance at DCN/Edge sites

This patch adds two new tripleo services that together support
deploying the glance-api service at edge sites. The service uses the
same glance database in the control plane, but allows other edge
services (e.g. cinder and nova) to access a glance endpoint that is
local to the edge site.

A new GlanceApiEdge service is a minor variant of the GlanceApi
service. The most significant change is it doesn't use the control
plane VIP, but instead configures cinder and nova services to access
the glance-api endpoint running on that edge node (not the VIP).

A companion HAproxyEdge service supports scaling out DCN sites with
larger (>3) number of nodes. Instead of deploying GlanceApiEdge on
every node, the HAproxyEdge service configures a local haproxy to
forward glance-api requests to the edge nodes running GlanceApiEdge.

The HAproxyEdge is extensible. While this patch is only concerned
with proxying glance-api, it can be extended to support additional
proxy requirements as needs arise.

blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache
Change-Id: Id6c416b8c7b3b6314d935e3eeb8a3f114492cecd
Depends-On: Ic8d652a5209219c96f795a8c18ceb457c6d9382a
"}, {'created': '2019-12-19 00:55:58.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to deploy glance at DCN/Edge sites

This patch adds two new tripleo services that together support
deploying the glance-api service at edge sites. The service uses the
same glance database in the control plane, but allows other edge
services (e.g. cinder and nova) to access a glance endpoint that is
local to the edge site.

A new GlanceApiEdge service is a minor variant of the GlanceApi
service. The most significant change is it doesn't use the control
plane VIP, but instead configures cinder and nova services to access
the glance-api endpoint running on that edge node (not the VIP).

A companion HAproxyEdge service supports scaling out DCN sites with
larger (>3) number of nodes. Instead of deploying GlanceApiEdge on
every node, the HAproxyEdge service configures a local haproxy to
forward glance-api requests to the edge nodes running GlanceApiEdge.

The HAproxyEdge is extensible. While this patch is only concerned
with proxying glance-api, it can be extended to support additional
proxy requirements as needs arise.

blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache
Change-Id: Id6c416b8c7b3b6314d935e3eeb8a3f114492cecd
Depends-On: Ic8d652a5209219c96f795a8c18ceb457c6d9382a
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to deploy glance at DCN/Edge sites

This patch adds two new tripleo services that together support
deploying the glance-api service at edge sites. The service uses the
same glance database in the control plane, but allows other edge
services (e.g. cinder and nova) to access a glance endpoint that is
local to the edge site.

A new GlanceApiEdge service is a minor variant of the GlanceApi
service. The most significant change is it doesn't use the control
plane VIP, but instead configures cinder and nova services to access
the glance-api endpoint running on that edge node (not the VIP).

A companion HAproxyEdge service supports scaling out DCN sites with
larger (>3) number of nodes. Instead of deploying GlanceApiEdge on
every node, the HAproxyEdge service configures a local haproxy to
forward glance-api requests to the edge nodes running GlanceApiEdge.

The HAproxyEdge is extensible. While this patch is only concerned
with proxying glance-api, it can be extended to support additional
proxy requirements as needs arise.

blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache
Change-Id: Id6c416b8c7b3b6314d935e3eeb8a3f114492cecd
Depends-On: Ic8d652a5209219c96f795a8c18ceb457c6d9382a

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: I499c5f2fb06caa70c939b6e503f65c14c2c2e474

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-12 09:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-18 15:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

-1 is for the typo in the release note.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:35:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

<mriedem> have you pushed stable branch changes to enable xvpvnc? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695853/
	<mriedem> i see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698591/1 but it's wrong
	<mriedem> the tempest patch has issues as well
	<stephenfin> Sorry, had to sanity check how that Tempest check was actually working
	<stephenfin> I still don't know how it does. XVP console is Xen-only. That shouldn't work unless Tempest was run with a XenServer backend
	<mriedem> stephenfin: it's not actually trying to get a console i don't think, just a url
	<mriedem> so if there isn't any special token handling for xvpvnc it doesn't seem like it is treated any different from vnc
	<mriedem> the url would be different, but the test isn't checking to see if the url can be used
	<lyarwood> so is it even worth keeping the tempest test in tree for older releases in that case?
	<stephenfin> lyarwood, mriedem: So I think that test is junk because nova doesn't seem to check whether it can actually support the requested console type
	<stephenfin> nova just requests _a_ console type from the virt driver https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L6681
	<stephenfin> so if you request the xvp type on the libvirt driver, it'll return a connection_info object with a URL that would never work
	<mriedem> i think i said all of that above
	<lyarwood> yup, do you want to push something to nuke it and I'll drop my change?
	<stephenfin> lyarwood: To answer your question, given that we're deprecating the XVP console type and using it previously would require Xen, which no one's tested in who knows how long, I'd nuke it from Tempest
	<stephenfin> no need for the config option
	<stephenfin> mriedem: and I'm agreeing with you :)
	<lyarwood> stephenfin: ack, I'll do that now then
	<mriedem> i'd support nuking that from tempest
	<mriedem> if someone using xen comes along and wants that later, they could write a tempest plugin
	<stephenfin> If they want it on < Ussuri, that is
	<stephenfin> since it'll be gone from then on, hopefully
	<mriedem> sure
	<mriedem> the plugin is branchless as well
	<stephenfin> doubtful, given Bob Ball (?) said they're using noVNC now too
	<lyarwood> goes back to PS1"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:45:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-18 16:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Lovely'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-18 18:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-12-18 19:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I agree with this approach:

- basically this test just verify CONF.vnc.xvpvncproxy_base_url value and does not verify the url with the added token by nova. 

- url return verification is done in nova unit tests also

- interop does not use this test so we are not removing any interop capability. 

- I cannot find if anyone else using this test to verify the xvpvnc console url.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2020-01-06 00:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove xvpvnc console type tests

Support for this Xen based console type is currently being removed from
Nova and as a result should no longer be tested by Tempest.

https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/remove-xvpvncproxy

The ServerActionsTestJSON.test_get_vnc_console test is now flattened to
only test the `novnc` console type.

A compute-feature-enabled configurable is not being used here as the
test itself only validated the returned URL and offers zero value,
especially given the lack of Xen coverage in the gate now.

Part of blueprint remove-xvpvncproxy
Change-Id: Ie6182ccd72770be1d2578062b5f5a8bb1267f84d

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: I2bdc65bacae6b89b520ca9b473e1d7bf2cafedee

commit_message:
Introduce CNI plugin for Zun

The CNI plugin is an executable that interacts with the Zun
CNI daemon.

Implements: blueprint support-cni
Change-Id: Iafc8a12bec04136b0c50aedb4ea7789af324f39d

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 support was dropped. Django 1.11 ends its extended support
in April 2020 which is before Ussuri release. Considering this,
horizon dropped Django 1.11 support.

Unnecessary Django version checks in the code are also dropped.

Change-Id: I2c58934f2b026745fbc97a58212b91d149db3657

commit_message:
Prepare non-primary Django tests in zuul jobs

We already have a template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
to test horizon and plugins with non-primary django versions,
but we still need to update tox.ini in all horizon plugins
whenever we change Django versions used.

This commit prepares per-Django environment in the zuul job.

Per-Django tox environments like py3-{dj111,dj20,dj22} are
no longer needed. It would be a big merit that we will no longer
need to update tox.ini in all horizon plugins.

The downside is that we do not provide a convenient way to
test it locally, but I think it can be covered in the document.

Change-Id: I726b19130ee9e7d06eb33231071c2673cfd3a49f

commit_message:
Complete "Drop Python 2.7 Support" goal

The goal definition in the TC repo [1] defines the completion criteria.
We have already completed 1, 2, 3 and partially 4 in [1].
This commit completes 4 (requirements.txt etc) and 5 (release note).

Python dependency in the installation guide is updated.
Django support plan in Ussuri is updated as well.
References to python 2.7 in the document are updated as well.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I0383920e32e053e1611519be774fab8dec124ccc

subject: sharding: Better-handle newlines in container names
messages:
[{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-30 20:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-30 20:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This is an alternative to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699892/

Basically I'm taking Tim's work tracking down all the places we need to quote/unquote headers but with a slightly different approach for backwards compatibility and rolling upgrades for the header names.  I have a hunch this might be slightly easier to reason about for new clusters and those that haven't yet been effected by the "Invalid header value" bug.

It seems to work, but I'm not 100% sure all the cases we care about in the upgrade case really get hit by the tests.  If this looks reasonable I should add some targeted unittests.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-02 18:38:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

there's at least one upgrade case where old code could read metadata quoted by new code and try and act on it like it's unquoted - if that breaks really really badly this might not be the way to go

I need to find some way to test it"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-03 01:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so writing down "quoted-paths: true" in sysmeta is pretty awful - for one an un-upgraded node can write down an *unquoted* root *after* an upgraded node wrote down "quoted_paths: true"

after replication takes the latest value for each key I've got an unquoted path that says "quoted_paths: true"

I also managed to get some lost objects into a shard named with the quoted value when the proxy sent down the target-shard quoted and the object forwarded it (i guess since the container was in an autocreate account it made a new db - which strangely itself doesn't think it's a shard despite being in the .shards_X namespace)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-05 16:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699892/ is the way to go!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-30 20:25:01.000000000', 'message': 'sharding: Better-handle newlines in container names

Previously, if you were on Python 2.7.10+ [0], such a newline would cause the
sharder to fail, complaining about invalid header values when trying to create
the shard containers. On older versions of Python, it would most likely cause a
parsing error in the container-server that was trying to handle the PUT.

Now, quote all places that we pass around container paths. This includes:

  * The X-Container-Sysmeta-Shard-Root sent when creating the (empty)
    remote shards
  * The X-Container-Sysmeta-Shard-Root included when initializing the
    local handoff for cleaving
  * The X-Backend-Container-Path the proxy sends to the object-server
    for container updates
  * The Location header the container-server sends to the
    object-server and object-updater

Note that a new header X-(Container-Sysmeta|Backend)-Quoted-Paths is
required so that receivers would know whether the value should be
unquoted or not.

Drive-by: fix a "conainer_name" typo that prevented us from testing that
we can shard a container with unicode in its name. Also, add more UTF8
probe tests.

[0] See https://bugs.python.org/issue22928

Change-Id: I09ba631dd2df36322ac234beef83c066e0fe2b99
Closes-Bug: 1856894
'}]
commit_message:
sharding: Better-handle newlines in container names

Previously, if you were on Python 2.7.10+ [0], such a newline would cause the
sharder to fail, complaining about invalid header values when trying to create
the shard containers. On older versions of Python, it would most likely cause a
parsing error in the container-server that was trying to handle the PUT.

Now, quote all places that we pass around container paths. This includes:

  * The X-Container-Sysmeta-Shard-Root sent when creating the (empty)
    remote shards
  * The X-Container-Sysmeta-Shard-Root included when initializing the
    local handoff for cleaving
  * The X-Backend-Container-Path the proxy sends to the object-server
    for container updates
  * The Location header the container-server sends to the
    object-server and object-updater

Note that a new header X-(Container-Sysmeta|Backend)-Quoted-Paths is
required so that receivers would know whether the value should be
unquoted or not.

Drive-by: fix a "conainer_name" typo that prevented us from testing that
we can shard a container with unicode in its name. Also, add more UTF8
probe tests.

[0] See https://bugs.python.org/issue22928

Change-Id: I09ba631dd2df36322ac234beef83c066e0fe2b99
Closes-Bug: 1856894

commit_message:
Fix container images names in migration plugin

Downstream CI ML2/OVS->ML2/OVN migration job fails on
prepare-migration : Set image tag (tripleo deployment) task due to
change in container images names from 'Docker*' to 'Container*' in
containers-default-parameters.yaml

Change-Id: Ie7578ac39a3cfdbe0e05ac50748e06c19b09f504

commit_message:
Switch SESSION_ENGINE to memcached

Previously we were using cached_db session backend by default.
However with django version update, it requires more recent
mysqlclient module which is not part of requirements.
Moreover usage of cached_db makes us to carry and maintain
extra stuff, which can be dropped with memcached backend.

Change-Id: I8df7ee967d8dcbeb09a42fd568f98acc3e88adad

commit_message:
Change parameter to 'coordination_uri'

class neutron::plugins::ml2::networking_ansible has 'coordination_uri'
parameter and not 'coordination_url'.

Change-Id: Ic7d9ba1c46e71b9d39cacf541e7c91d5caf48a60
Closes-Bug: #1857605

commit_message:
Try deleting container for failures too

We currently retry when podman run returns with exit code 0 and 2.
in container-puppet.py. It's possible that container storage bits
are already created for failure. It's better to delete the container
and it's storage before retrying.

Change-Id: I4449c52b954c27e31553230cbdbd0949ae6413d6
Related-Bug: #1856086
(cherry picked from commit 2f8964133883a5c795a88b521f2bb30818d448b2)
